_README: This file contains all evaluation criteria for the NPC Structural Checklist Review. Each sub-criteria has a name, question, and 5 scoring levels. The client can edit any text in this file. The scoring levels must stay as 0.0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, and 1.0 - do not change the score values, only the descriptions.

components.name: Baselines, Benchmarks, & Trends
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy document includes a thorough analysis of the current state, comparative benchmarking, and forward-looking trends.

sub_components.name: Diagnostic (SWOT, gap analysis, quantified baseline)
sub_components.question: Does the document provide a structured diagnostic of the current state, including a SWOT analysis, gap analysis, and quantified baseline data?

scoring.0.0: No diagnostic, SWOT, gap analysis, or baseline data is present in the document.
scoring.0.25: Very high-level or vague mention of current state without structured analysis or data.
scoring.0.5: Diagnostic exists (e.g., qualitative SWOT) but is incomplete - missing quantified baselines or gap analysis.
scoring.0.75: Well-developed diagnostic with quantified baselines but minor gaps in depth or coverage.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive diagnostic with fully quantified baselines, structured SWOT, and detailed gap analysis.

sub_components.name: Benchmarks & Comparisons
sub_components.question: Does the document include benchmarking against peer countries or leading institutions, with comparative data and lessons learned?

scoring.0.0: No benchmarking or comparative analysis present.
scoring.0.25: Vague mention of peer countries or comparators without any data or specifics.
scoring.0.5: Some benchmarking present but limited in scope - few comparators or incomplete data.
scoring.0.75: Good benchmarking with multiple comparators and data, minor gaps in lessons learned.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive benchmarking with regional/international comparators, detailed data, and documented lessons learned.

sub_components.name: Trends
sub_components.question: Does the document identify and analyze global, regional, and sectoral trends, and integrate them into the strategic direction?

scoring.0.25: Brief or vague mention of trends without analysis or linkage to strategy.
scoring.0.5: Some trends identified but analysis is surface-level or not linked to strategic direction.
scoring.0.75: Good trends analysis covering global/regional trends with mostly clear linkage to strategy.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive trends analysis (global, regional, sectoral) fully integrated into strategic direction.

components.name: Vision, Mission & Values
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy clearly defines a vision, mission, and values that are ambitious, aligned with national direction, and operationally relevant.

sub_components.name: Vision
sub_components.question: Does the document contain a clear, ambitious vision statement that is aligned with Qatars national direction (QNV 2030, NDS3)?

scoring.0.25: Vision exists but is vague, generic, or not aligned with national direction.
scoring.0.5: Vision is stated but lacks ambition, specificity, or clear national alignment.
scoring.0.75: Clear and ambitious vision with good national alignment but minor clarity gaps.
scoring.1.0: Clear, ambitious, measurable vision fully aligned with Qatar national direction (QNV 2030, NDS3).

sub_components.name: Mission
sub_components.question: Does the document contain a mission statement that clearly articulates purpose, scope, and target beneficiaries?

scoring.0.25: Mission exists but is vague or does not articulate purpose and scope.
scoring.0.5: Mission is stated but incomplete - missing either purpose, scope, or target beneficiaries.
scoring.0.75: Good mission statement with clear purpose and scope, minor gaps in specificity.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive mission clearly articulating purpose, scope, and target beneficiaries.

sub_components.name: Values
sub_components.question: Does the document define values that are aligned with the entity/sector mandate and are operationally relevant?

scoring.0.25: Values mentioned but generic and not linked to entity/sector mandate.
scoring.0.5: Values defined but only partially aligned with mandate or lacking operational relevance.
scoring.0.75: Values well-defined and mostly aligned with mandate, minor gaps in operational linkage.
scoring.1.0: Values clearly defined, fully aligned with mandate, and operationally relevant.

components.name: Strategic Objectives & KPIs
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy defines clear, measurable objectives supported by well-defined KPIs with baselines, targets, and SMART criteria.

sub_components.name: Strategic Objectives / Pillars
sub_components.question: Does the document define strategic objectives or pillars that are measurable and clearly linked to the vision and mission?

scoring.0.0: No strategic objectives or pillars defined.
scoring.0.25: Objectives mentioned but vague, not measurable, or poorly structured.
scoring.0.5: Objectives defined but some lack measurability or clear linkage to vision.
scoring.0.75: Well-defined objectives/pillars with mostly clear measurability, minor gaps.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive, measurable strategic objectives/pillars fully linked to vision and mission.

sub_components.name: KPI Definition
sub_components.question: Does the document define KPIs with full methodology, measurement cadence, data source, and calculation method?

scoring.0.25: KPIs listed but without methodology, measurement cadence, or data source.
scoring.0.5: KPIs defined with some methodology but missing cadence, data source, or calculation details.
scoring.0.75: Good KPI definitions with methodology and cadence, minor gaps in data source or clarity.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive KPI definitions with full methodology, measurement cadence, data source, and calculation method.

sub_components.name: Baselines & Targets
sub_components.question: Does the document provide quantified baselines and time-bound targets for all KPIs?

scoring.0.0: No baselines or targets provided for KPIs.
scoring.0.25: Some targets exist but no baselines, or baselines without targets.
scoring.0.5: Partial baselines and targets - some KPIs covered, others missing.
scoring.0.75: Most KPIs have baselines and targets, minor gaps in coverage or time-bounding.
scoring.1.0: All KPIs have quantified baselines and time-bound targets with clear milestones.

sub_components.name: SMART Criteria
sub_components.question: Are KPIs designed to meet SMART criteria (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound)?

scoring.0.25: KPIs listed but vague and do not meet SMART criteria.
scoring.0.5: Some KPIs are measurable, but others are too broad or lacking calculation methodology.
scoring.0.75: Most KPIs are SMART but with minor issues (e.g., relevant but not time-bound, or measurable but no calculation method).
scoring.1.0: All KPIs fully SMART, with baselines, targets, calculation methodology, and relevance to institutional excellence.

components.name: Governance Model
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy defines clear internal and external governance structures with coordination mechanisms.

sub_components.name: Internal Stakeholder Ecosystem
sub_components.question: Does the document describe a clear internal governance structure with committees, roles, responsibilities, and decision-making flows?

scoring.0.25: Brief mention of governance without roles, committees, or decision-making structure.
scoring.0.5: Some governance elements described but incomplete - missing roles or decision-making clarity.
scoring.0.75: Good internal governance with committees and roles, minor gaps in decision-making flows.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive internal governance with clear committees, roles, responsibilities, and decision-making flows.

sub_components.name: External Stakeholder Ecosystem
sub_components.question: Does the document identify external stakeholders with clear roles, responsibilities, and engagement mechanisms?

scoring.0.25: External stakeholders briefly mentioned without roles or engagement model.
scoring.0.5: Some external stakeholders mapped but roles or engagement mechanisms are incomplete.
scoring.0.75: Good external stakeholder mapping with roles, minor gaps in engagement mechanisms.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive external stakeholder ecosystem with clear roles, responsibilities, and engagement model.

sub_components.name: Coordination & Interaction Mechanisms
sub_components.question: Does the document define coordination mechanisms with clear cadence, format, escalation paths, and accountability?

scoring.0.25: Vague mention of coordination without specific mechanisms or cadence.
scoring.0.5: Some coordination mechanisms exist but lack detail on cadence, format, or accountability.
scoring.0.75: Good coordination mechanisms with mostly clear cadence and format, minor gaps.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive coordination mechanisms with clear cadence, format, escalation paths, and accountability.

components.name: Initiatives & Projects
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy identifies transformative initiatives linked to objectives and projects derived from those initiatives.

sub_components.name: Transformative Initiatives Linked To Objectives
sub_components.question: Are initiatives clearly defined, transformative (not BAU), and explicitly linked to strategic objectives/pillars?

scoring.0.25: Few initiatives named but vague and not transformative, or not linked to objectives.
scoring.0.5: Initiatives described but not explicitly tied to objectives or lacking transformative scope.
scoring.0.75: Initiatives defined and linked to some objectives but with limited transformative scope or impact.
scoring.1.0: All initiatives clearly defined, transformative, and explicitly linked to objectives and pillars.

sub_components.name: Projects Derived From Initiatives
sub_components.question: Are projects clearly defined, derived from initiatives, and do they have a clear scope and deliverables?

scoring.0.25: Projects mentioned vaguely without scope or link to initiatives.
scoring.0.5: Some projects derived from initiatives, but not all and lacking detail.
scoring.0.75: Most projects clearly derived and defined with scope/deliverables, but some gaps remain.
scoring.1.0: All projects explicitly derived from initiatives, with clear scope and deliverables.

components.name: Project Description, Timeline, & Budgets
components.description: Assesses whether projects have complete descriptions with owners, implementation timelines, and budget allocations.

sub_components.name: Project Description And Owners
sub_components.question: Are projects clearly described with defined owners, roles, and responsibilities?

scoring.0.0: No project descriptions provided and no owners identified.
scoring.0.25: Short or vague descriptions with no clear owner or role.
scoring.0.5: Some projects described with owners, but roles unclear or overlapping.
scoring.0.75: Most projects have clear descriptions and owners with defined roles.
scoring.1.0: All projects are clearly described with defined owners, roles, and alignment with objectives.

sub_components.name: Project Timelines
sub_components.question: Does the document include detailed implementation timelines for all projects with milestones, phases, and dependencies?

scoring.0.25: Very high-level timeline without milestones or phasing.
scoring.0.5: Some timelines exist but inconsistent - some projects have milestones, others do not.
scoring.0.75: Good timelines with milestones and phases for most projects, minor gaps.
scoring.1.0: Detailed implementation timelines for all projects with milestones, phases, and dependencies.

sub_components.name: Project Budgets
sub_components.question: Does the document provide comprehensive budget allocations per project with funding sources, phasing, and cost breakdowns?

scoring.0.25: High-level total budget mentioned without per-project breakdown.
scoring.0.5: Some budget allocation per project but inconsistent or missing funding sources.
scoring.0.75: Good budget allocation for most projects with funding sources, minor gaps.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive budget allocation per project with funding sources, phasing, and cost breakdowns.

components.name: Risks & Mitigation Measures
components.description: Assesses whether the strategy identifies risks systematically and defines mitigation strategies with clear ownership.

sub_components.name: Risk Identification
sub_components.question: Does the document include a dedicated risk management section with a risk register that systematically identifies, categorizes, and assesses implementation risks (likelihood and impact)?

scoring.0.0: No dedicated risk section, risk register, or risk matrix present. Note: a 'Challenges' or 'Problems' section describing the sector's current issues is diagnostic content (Criteria 1), NOT risk identification. Implementation risks address what could go wrong DURING strategy execution (e.g., funding gaps, capacity shortfalls, coordination failures, political changes, technology risks).
scoring.0.25: Brief or generic mention of implementation risks without a structured register, categorization, or assessment.
scoring.0.5: Some implementation risks identified in a dedicated section but lacking systematic categorization, likelihood ratings, or impact assessment.
scoring.0.75: Good risk identification with a dedicated section covering multiple implementation risks with categorization and mostly assessed likelihood/impact, minor gaps.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive risk register with systematic identification of implementation risks, categorization, likelihood ratings, and impact assessment.

sub_components.name: Mitigation Measures
sub_components.question: Does the document define mitigation strategies for identified implementation risks with clear ownership, timelines, and contingency plans?

scoring.0.0: No mitigation measures for implementation risks defined. Note: the strategy's own projects and action plans (Criteria 5-6) are the strategy's CORE ACTIVITIES â€” they are NOT risk mitigation measures. Mitigation measures address risks TO the strategy's execution (e.g., 'If funding is delayed, prioritize Phase 1 projects'). If no implementation risks are identified in 7.1, score 0.0 here.
scoring.0.25: Generic mitigation mentioned for implementation risks without specific actions or ownership.
scoring.0.5: Some mitigation strategies defined for implementation risks but not all risks covered or lacking ownership.
scoring.0.75: Good mitigation strategies for most identified implementation risks with ownership, minor gaps in coverage.
scoring.1.0: Comprehensive mitigation strategies for all identified implementation risks with clear ownership, timelines, and contingency plans.
